snippet: Friends gathered to remember Everett and Evelyn Ortner, who vigorously promoted Brooklyn as a historic site worth preserving.
abstract: Elizabeth A Harris The Appraisal column remembers Everett and Evelyn Ortner, who were vigorous promoters of Brooklyn's charms and historical worth; the Ortners, who moved to Park Slope in 1963, agitated for preservation and convinced Manhattan residents to buy and renovate Brooklyn brownstones, which now command high prices; Everett Ortner recently died at age 92, and his wife died in 2006.
lead_paragraph: Friends gathered to remember Everett and Evelyn Ortner, who vigorously promoted Brooklyn as a historic site worth preserving.

headline.seo: Honoring Legacy of Everett and Evelyn Ortner, Who Lured Many to Brooklyn Brownstones
headline.main: A Couple Who Gave Brownstones New Life
headline.print_headline: Remembering a Couple Who Gave Brownstones New Life
